sentences.text: You are invited to join us at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of FTI Consulting, Inc., a Maryland corporation, on Wednesday, June 7, 2017, at 9:30 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time, at our executive office, which will be located at 555 12th Street NW, Washington, DC 20004 at the time of the meeting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attached you will find a Notice of Meeting and our Proxy Statement, which contains information regarding the proposals that the Board of Directors is submitting to a vote of the stockholders, as well as instructions on how to vote your shares of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the meeting in person, you must register in advance by no later than May 24, 2017, and obtain an admission ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please respond affirmatively to the request for that information on the Internet or mark that box on the proxy card if you received paper copies of the proxy materials.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FINANCIAL AND OPERATING HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Improved Our 2016 Financial and Operational Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to execute on our strategy of organic growth and key growth initiatives as demonstrated by the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we INCREASED earnings per diluted share (EPS) and adjusted earnings per diluted share (Adjusted EPS (1)) to $2.05 and $2.24, respectively, for the year ended December 31, 2016, from $1.58 and $1.84, respectively, for the year ended December 31, 2015, an increase of 29.7% and 21.7%, respectively;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we INCREASED net income to $85.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2016 from $66.1 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, an increase of 29.5%;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we INCREASED revenues to $1.81 billion for the year ended December 31, 2016, an increase of 1.8%, compared with $1.78 billion for the prior year (excluding the estimated negative impact of foreign currency translation, revenues increased 3.6% compared with the prior year);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we INCREASED net cash provided by operating activities to $233.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2016 from $139.9 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, an increase of 66.9%; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the closing price of our common stock, par value $0.01 per share (Common Stock), reported on the New York Stock Exchange INCREASED to $45.08 per share on December 30, 2016 from $33.80 per share on January 4, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Deployed Our Capital Wisely.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we used our cash to increase stockholder value as demonstrated by the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we DECREASED our total debt by $130.0 million to $370.0 million at December 31, 2016 from $500.0 million at December 31, 2015, by reducing the balance of borrowings under our senior secured bank credit facility;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we REDUCED our Leverage Ratio (1) (total debt divided by Adjusted EBITDA (1)) to 1.82 at December 31, 2016 from 2.43 at December 31, 2015;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we REPURCHASED 537,400 shares of our Common Stock during 2016, at an average per share price of $39.97, for an aggregate cost of $21.5 million, under the $100.0 million stock repurchase program authorized by the Board of Directors (the Board) on June 2, 2016; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we GREW our headcount year-over-year with a net increase of 80 billable professionals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Adjusted EPS, Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted Net Cash Flow, which are referenced in this Proxy Summary, are financial measures not prepared in accordance with Accounting Principles Generally Accepted in the United States (GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of these non-GAAP financial measures refer to Executive Officers and CompensationExecutive SummaryWe Improved Our 2016 Financial and Operational Performance on page 44 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Appendix B for the definition of each of these non-GAAP measures and the reconciliation to the most directly comparable GAAP measure.

sentences.text: We have defined Leverage Ratio as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) total debt, divided by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Adjusted EBITDA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leverage Ratio does not have a most directly comparable GAAP measure to which it can be reconciled.

sentences.text: 2016 STOCKHOLDER ENGAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Listened.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we held discussions regarding our executive compensation programs with 11 of our largest stockholders holding an aggregate of 55.5% of our outstanding shares of Common Stock as of December 31, 2016, and, after considering their feedback, our Compensation Committee strengthened our 2016 annual incentive pay (AIP) and 2016 long-term incentive pay (LTIP) programs with the following changes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increased the 2016 AIP objective performance threshold based on adjusted net cash provided by operating activities (Adjusted Net Cash Flow (1)) to $75.0 million from $72.0 million for 2015;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: substituted Adjusted EBITDA (in lieu of Adjusted Net Cash Flow), as an operative performance metric for purposes of determining one-third of target AIP payable to eligible executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: capped the LTIP payout on negative total shareholder return (TSR) performance relative to the S&P 500 at 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS (PAGES 44 TO 57)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Compensation Programs Reward the Performance of Our President and Chief Executive Officer (our CEO) We believe that our 2016 compensation programs reward our CEO for generating value for our stockholders, as demonstrated by the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 70.5% of total compensation delivered to our CEO was variable and tied to performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 66.7% of variable AIP opportunity delivered to our CEO was tied to annual financial performance measures based on Adjusted EPS and Adjusted EBITDA, and the balance of AIP was based on the Compensation Committees subjective evaluation of our CEOs performance, paying out the aggregate amount at 123.68% of target for 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50.0% of variable LTIP opportunity was delivered to our CEO in the form of performance-based restricted stock units, subject to an objective financial performance measure based on our achievement of TSR levels relative to the S&P 500, measured over the three-year period ending December 31, 2018;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 25.0% of variable LTIP opportunity was delivered to our CEO in the form of stock options, subject to an exercise price equal to 100% of the closing price per share of our Common Stock on the grant date and pro rata three-year vesting conditions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 25.0% of LTIP opportunity was delivered to our CEO in the form of shares of restricted stock, subject to pro rata three-year vesting conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO Compensation Programs Promote Pay-for-Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since our CEO joined us in January 2014, we have:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capped annual cash base salary of our CEO at $1.0 million;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased our CEO stock ownership requirement to five times (5x) annual cash base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased the percentage of AIP opportunity that is subject to financial performance to 66.7% of target AIP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased the percentage of LTIP opportunity that is subject to financial performance (including stock options) to 75% of target LTIP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited severance payable to our CEO upon termination by the Company without Cause or by our CEO for Good Reason to an amount equal to one and one-half times (1.5x) the sum of annual cash base salary plus target AIP (increasing to two times (2x) the sum of annual cash base salary plus target AIP if such termination occurs during the 18-month period following a Change in Control) (as defined in our CEOs employment agreement);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated automatic single trigger acceleration of LTIP awards, general equity awards and severance benefits on a change in control; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Added a relative TSR cap for negative performance at 100% of target, regardless of actual TSR performance, beginning with the LTIP opportunity in the form of performance-based restricted stock units awarded in 2016 for the three-year measurement period ending December 31, 2018.

sentences.text: No. 2 Vote on the approval of the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Incentive Compensation Plan (the 2017 Plan)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective upon the approval of stockholders, the 2017 Plan will
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) authorize shares of our Common Stock for equity awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) restrict the release of accumulated dividends and dividend equivalents on account of unearned equity awards, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) limit total compensation (consisting of cash retainers and other cash compensation, as well as equity awards granted under the 2017 Plan) payable per non-employee director per calendar year to $750,000 We believe that the available shares of our Common Stock under the 2017 Plan will be sufficient to cover our equity needs for three years (including 2017), through our judicious use of equity compensation as evidenced by our adjusted burn rate of 3.89% (compared with the adjusted burn rate of 4.14% of our industry classification group) for the three-year period ended December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors (our Board) is soliciting your proxy to be voted at our Annual Meeting because you were a stockholder of the Company at the close of business on March 29, 2017, the record date for the Annual Meeting (the Record Date), and are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting or any postponement or adjournment of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement (Proxy Statement) provides information that you should read before you vote (or authorize a proxy to vote) on the proposals that will be presented to you at the Annual Meeting and is intended to assist you in deciding how to vote your shares of common stock, par value $0.01 per share (Common Stock), of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about April 25, 2017, we began mailing or emailing a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice) containing instructions on how to access this Proxy Statement and our Annual Report to Stockholders for the year ended December 31, 2016 (the Annual Report) online, and we began sending a full set of the proxy materials and Annual Report to stockholders who previously requested paper copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING AND VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHY AM I RECEIVING THESE PROXY MATERIALS?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are invited to attend the Annual Meeting and are entitled to vote on the items of business described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy materials include the Notice of Annual Meeting, this Proxy Statement for the Annual Meeting and our Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of these materials by mail or email, the proxy materials also include a proxy card or voting instruction card for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information in this Proxy Statement describes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the proposals to be voted on at the Annual Meeting,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the voting process,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the eight nominees for director named in this Proxy Statement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) information about our Board and committees of our Board (the Committees),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) the compensation of our named executive officers and non-employee directors for the year ended December 31, 2016, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) certain other information we are required to or have chosen to provide to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHEN AND WHERE WILL THE COMPANY HOLD THE ANNUAL MEETING?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will be held on Wednesday, June 7, 2017, at 9:30 a.m., Eastern Daylight Time, at our executive office located at 555 12th Street NW, Washington, DC 20004, telephone no.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHO MAY VOTE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote all of the shares of our Common Stock that you own of record at the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast one vote for each share that you own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the close of business on the Record Date, 41,316,852 shares of our Common Stock were issued and outstanding, and entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT IS A QUORUM?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum must be present at the Annual Meeting in order to transact business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum will be present if a majority of our shares of Common Stock entitled to vote are represented at the Annual Meeting, either in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is not present, no business may be conducted at the Annual Meeting, in which case the Annual Meeting may be adjourned, without a vote of stockholders by the chairman of the Annual Meeting, until such time as a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies received and marked as abstentions from voting on a proposal, and broker non-votes are counted for determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote results when a trust, broker, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary that holds shares for another person has not received voting instructions from the owner of the shares and, under the applicable rules, does not have the discretionary authority to vote on a matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a properly executed proxy has not been returned, the holder is not present for quorum purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT AM I VOTING ON, HOW MANY VOTES ARE REQUIRED TO ELECT DIRECTORS AND APPROVE THE OTHER PROPOSALS, AND HOW DOES THE BOARD RECOMMEND I VOTE?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1: Elect as directors the eight nominees named in the Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As there are eight nominees for the eight seats up for election, each nominee will be elected as a director if he or she receives the affirmative vote of a majority of the total votes cast FOR and WITHHELD with respect to his or her election as a director at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any abstentions or broker non-votes are not counted as votes cast either FOR or WITHHELD with respect to a directors election and will have no effect on the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR the election of each nominee as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2: Vote on the approval of the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Incentive Compensation Plan Approval of the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Incentive Compensation Plan, effective as of June 7, 2017, requires a majority of the votes cast on the proposal at the Annual Meeting to be voted FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this proposal, pursuant to the rules of the New York Stock Exchange (the NYSE), abstentions will constitute votes cast and, therefore, will have the same effect as votes AGAINST the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will not have any effect on the result of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3: Ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP (KPMG) as FTI Consulting, Inc.s independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017 Ratification of the appointment of KPMG as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017 requires a majority of the votes cast on the proposal at the Annual Meeting to be voted FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will not count as votes cast either FOR or AGAINST Proposal No. 3, and will have no effect on the results of the vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 4: Vote on an advisory (non-binding) resolution to approve the compensation of the named executive officers as described in the Proxy Statement The approval of a resolution approving the compensation of our named executive officers as described in this Proxy Statement is an advisory (non-binding) vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board and the Compensation Committee will consider the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast FOR the proposal as approval of the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers as described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not be counted as votes cast either FOR or AGAINST Proposal No. 4, and will have no effect on the results of the vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR the advisory (non-binding) resolution to approve the compensation of our named executive officers as described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 5: Advisory (non-binding) vote on the frequency of an advisory (non-binding) vote on executive compensation A majority of the votes cast for Proposal No. 5 will determine the stockholders preferred frequency for holding an advisory (non-binding) vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the option for holding an advisory vote every 1 year, every 2 years, or every 3 years receiving a majority of the votes cast on Proposal No. 5 will be considered the preferred frequency of the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that no option receives a majority of the votes cast, we will consider the option receiving the most votes to be the option selected by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any abstentions or broker non-votes will not be counted as votes cast with respect to Proposal No. 5, and will have no effect on the results of the vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign, date and return a proxy card, but do not complete voting instructions for a proposal, your shares will be voted with respect to such proposal by the named proxies in accordance with the Boards above recommendations and in the discretion of the proxy holder on any other matter that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW DO I VOTE MY SHARES?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have one vote for each share of Common Stock that you owned of record at the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting in person, please authorize a proxy to vote your shares right away, using one of the following advance voting methods and following the instructions on the Notice or the proxy card that you received from us, or voting instruction card that you received from your broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting by proxy, you will be directing the persons designated as proxy holders as your proxies to vote your shares of Common Stock at the Annual Meeting in accordance with your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign, date and return a proxy card, but do not complete voting instructions for a proposal, your shares will be voted with respect to such proposal by the named proxies in accordance with the Boards recommendations and in the discretion of the proxy holders on any other matter that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Person?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can attend the Annual Meeting, and complete and submit a ballot, if you are a stockholder of record, meaning that you hold your shares in certificate form or through an account with our transfer agent, American Stock Transfer & Trust Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are not a stockholder of record, but hold your shares through a broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary, you must obtain a legal proxy giving you the right to vote such shares from such record holder in order to vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See How Do I Attend the Annual Meeting in Person?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: on page 6 for instructions on how to obtain an admission ticket and the other requirements to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Internet?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote by visiting www.proxyvote.com if you received a Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also vote by following the instructions if you received a paper proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet voting is available 24 hours a day until 11:59 p.m., Eastern Daylight Time, on June 6, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be given the opportunity to confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote by telephone by calling toll free +1.800.690.6903 and following the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who are beneficial owners and who receive paper voting instruction cards, may vote by telephone by calling the number specified on the voting instruction card provided by their broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone voting is available 24 hours a day until 11:59 p.m., Eastern Daylight Time, on June 6, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Mail?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of a proxy card or voting instruction card, you may vote by completing, signing and dating the proxy card or voting instruction card, and returning it in the accompanying pre-addressed envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IF YOU DECIDE TO VOTE BY MAIL, YOUR PROXY CARD WILL BE VALID ONLY IF YOU COMPLETE, SIGN, DATE AND RETURN IT BEFORE THE ANNUAL MEETING DATE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote via the Internet or by telephone, please do not return a paper proxy card or voting instruction card to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHY DID I RECEIVE A NOTICE OF INTERNET AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are sending a Notice, by mail or email, to many stockholders instead of paper copies of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders receiving the Notice will find instructions on how to access this Proxy Statement and our Annual Report on the website referred to in the Notice or to request a printed set of these materials at no charge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive future proxy materials by email will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents, and will reduce the impact on the environment of holding annual meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials by email will remain in effect until its terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Notice will contain instructions on how to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: view our proxy materials for the Annual Meeting on the Internet;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: view our Annual Report on the Internet;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vote your shares; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: instruct us to send future proxy materials to you by mail or electronically by email.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CAN I VOTE MY SHARES BY FILLING OUT AND RETURNING THE NOTICE?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice identifies the items to be voted on at the Annual Meeting, but you cannot vote by marking and returning the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice provides instructions on how to vote by Internet, by telephone, by requesting a paper proxy card, or by attending the Annual Meeting and submitting a ballot in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHY DID I RECEIVE PAPER COPIES OF THE PROXY MATERIALS AND ANNUAL REPORT?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing some of our stockholders, including stockholders who have previously requested paper copies of the proxy materials and Annual Report, and some of our stockholders who live outside the United States (U.S.), with paper copies of this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report, instead of the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, any stockholder may request to receive proxy materials in printed form by mail or electronically by email on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW CAN I REQUEST PAPER COPIES OF THE PROXY MATERIALS AND ANNUAL REPORT?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders will find instructions about how to obtain paper copies of the proxy materials and Annual Report in the Notice or the email you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHO PAYS THE COSTS OF THE PROXY SOLICITATION?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will pay the cost of soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the mailing and emailing of the Notice, and these proxy materials and the Annual Report, the solicitation of proxies or votes may be made in person, by telephone or by electronic communication by our officers, directors and employees, who will not receive any additional compensation for such solicitation activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT DOES IT MEAN IF I RECEIVED MORE THAN ONE PROXY CARD OR VOTING INSTRUCTION CARD?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive more than one proxy card or voting instruction card, it means that you have multiple accounts with our transfer agent and/or a broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary, or you may hold shares in different ways or in multiple names (such as through joint tenancy, trusts and custodial accounts).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote all of your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WILL MY SHARES BE VOTED IF I DO NOT COMPLETE, SIGN, DATE AND RETURN MY PROXY CARD OR VOTING INSTRUCTION CARD, OR VOTE BY SOME OTHER METHOD?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered record stockholder and you do not vote your shares by Internet or by telephone, or by completing, signing, dating and returning a paper proxy card or voting instruction card, your shares will not be voted unless you attend the Annual Meeting and vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if you sign, date and return a proxy card, but do not complete voting instructions for a proposal, your shares will be voted with respect to such proposal by the named proxies in accordance with the Boards recommendations and in the discretion of the proxy holder on any other matter that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a brokerage account or by a trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary, you are considered the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, and the Notice or proxy materials were forwarded to you by that organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to vote your shares, you must follow the voting instructions forwarded to you by or on behalf of that organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokerage firms, trusts, banks, or other nominees and fiduciaries are required to request voting instructions for shares they hold on behalf of customers and others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct the record holder how to vote and you are also invited to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to provide instructions to your broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary on how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since a beneficial owner is not the record stockholder, you may not vote the shares in person at the Annual Meeting unless you obtain a legal proxy from the record holder giving you the right to vote the shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you do not provide voting instructions on your voting instruction card, if you hold shares through an account with a broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary your shares may be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokerage firms have the authority under NYSE rules to vote shares for which their customers do not provide voting instructions on certain routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3, to ratify the appointment of KPMG as our independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017, is considered a routine matter for which brokers, trusts, banks, or other nominees or fiduciaries may vote in the absence of specific instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a proposal is not considered routine and the broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary has not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner of the shares with respect to such proposal, such firm cannot vote the shares on that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All proposals, other than Proposal No. 3, are non-routine proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes that cannot be cast by a broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary on non-routine matters are known as broker non-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW CAN I REVOKE MY PROXY AND CHANGE MY VOTE PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL MEETING?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may change your vote at any time prior to the vote taken at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke or change your vote in any one of four ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may notify our Corporate Secretary, at our office at 2 Hamill Road, North Building, Baltimore, Maryland 21210, in writing that you wish to revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may submit a proxy dated later than your original proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may attend the Annual Meeting and vote by ballot if you are a stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Merely attending the Annual Meeting will not by itself revoke a proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must submit a ballot and vote your shares of Common Stock at the Annua Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shares you hold beneficially or in street name, you may change your vote by following the specific voting instructions provided to you by the record holder to change or revoke any instructions you have already provided, or, if you obtained a legal proxy from your broker, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary giving you the right to vote your shares, by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW DO I ATTEND THE ANNUAL MEETING IN PERSON?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, you must register in advance by no later than May 24, 2017 and follow these instructions to gain admission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting is limited to stockholders as of the close of business on the Record Date or their authorized representatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cameras, sound or video recording equipment, cellular telephones, smartphones or other similar equipment, and electronic devices will not be allowed in the meeting room.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To gain admission to the Annual Meeting, you must present an admission ticket and valid picture identification, such as a drivers license or passport.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If You Vote by Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record and receive your proxy materials by mail, you must mark the box on the proxy card you return to the Company indicating that you will attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your admission ticket is attached to your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If You Vote by Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record and receive your materials electronically, and vote via the Internet, there will be instructions to follow when voting to register to attend the Annual Meeting and print out your admission ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, bring the notice or voting instruction card that you received from the record holder to be admitted to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will also be asked to present your brokerage statement reflecting your ownership of shares prior to the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will not be able to vote your shares at the Annual Meeting without a legal proxy from the record holder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authorized Named Representatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder as of the Record Date and intend to appoint an authorized named representative to attend the Annual Meeting on your behalf, you must send a written request for an admission ticket by regular mail to our Corporate Secretary at FTI Consulting, Inc., 2 Hamill Road, North Building, Baltimore, Maryland 21210 or by fax to +1.410.951.4878.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests for authorized named representatives to attend the Annual Meeting must be received by no later than Wednesday, May 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please include the following information when submitting your request:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) your name and complete mailing address;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) proof that you own shares of Common Stock of the Company prior to the close of business on the Record Date (such as a brokerage statement showing your name and address or a letter from the brokerage firm, trust, bank, or other nominee or fiduciary holding your shares);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a signed authorization appointing such individual to be your authorized named representative at the meeting, which includes the individuals name, mailing address, telephone number and email address, and a description of the extent of his or her authority; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a legal proxy if you intend such representative to vote your shares at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reserve the right to deny entry to the Annual Meeting if the above conditions are not satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about April 25, 2017, we began sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials, including Internet availability of the Annual Report, or the Notice of the Annual Meeting, this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report in paper copies, to the Companys stockholders of record as of the close of business on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report does not constitute a part of the proxy solicitation materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Report provides you with additional information about the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of our Notice of Annual Meeting, Proxy Statement and Annual Report are available on our website at http://www.fticonsulting.com, under AboutGovernanceAnnual Reports & Proxy Statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND COMMITTEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE DIRECTOR NOMINATION PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identification of Candidates as Directors for Election at the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board currently consists of eight directors, seven of whom are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee works with the Board to develop the education, credentials and characteristics required of Board nominees in light of current Board composition, our business and operations, our long-term and short-term plans, applicable legal and listing requirements, and other factors the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee considers relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee evaluates existing directors for reelection each year as if they were new candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may identify other candidates for nomination as directors, if necessary, through recommendations from our directors, management, employees, stockholders or outside consultants, as well as through the formal stockholder nomination process described under Corporate GovernanceStockholder Nominees for Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will review candidates in the same manner regardless of the source of the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is authorized, in its sole discretion, to engage outside search firms and consultants to assist with the process of identifying and qualifying candidates, and has the sole authority to negotiate the fees and terms of the retention of such advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board focus on identifying nominees and candidates for nomination as a director who have a diversity of ages, backgrounds, skills and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board increased its gender diversity by adding Laureen Seeger as a director effective March 7, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key director attributes that are considered by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience holding a significant leadership position in a complex organization or experience dealing with complex problems, including a practical understanding of strategy, processes, risk management and other factors that drive growth and change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance or Accounting Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience with finance and/or financial reporting that demonstrates an understanding of finance and financial information and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Services or Industry Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience with our key practice offerings or client industries, such as capital markets, mergers and acquisitions, consulting, energy, financial institutions, healthcare, and telecom, media and technology, to deepen the Boards understanding and knowledge of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Government Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience working constructively and proactively with governments and agencies, both foreign and domestic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Board Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience serving on the boards and board committees of other public companies provides an understanding of corporate governance practices and trends and insights into board management and the relationships among the board, the chief executive officer and other members of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Global Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience managing or growing companies outside the U.S. or with global companies to broaden our knowledge, help direct our global expansion and help navigate the hurdles of doing business outside the U.S.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board consider other factors, as it determines to be appropriate, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Integrity and Credibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High ethical standards and strength of character in the candidates personal and professional dealings, and a willingness to be held accountable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mature and practical judgment, and a history of making good business decisions in good faith and in a manner that will be in the best interests of the Company and its stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Collaborative Work Ethic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ability to work together with other directors and management to carry out his or her duties in the best interests of the Company and its stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Need for Expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The extent to which the candidate has some quality or experience that would fill a present need on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sufficient Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENCE OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established Categorical Standards of Director Independence, which are the same as the NYSE Section 303A standards governing director independence as currently in effect, and recognizes that a director is independent if he or she does not have a material relationship with the Company (directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company), considering all facts and circumstances that the Board determines are relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on those standards, the Board, upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, affirmatively determined that all seven current non-employee directors standing for reelection at the Annual Meeting are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steven H. Gunby is not considered independent for these purposes since he is our President and Chief Executive Officer (our CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its independence determinations, the Board considered that Nicholas C. Fanandakis is Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Company, and Laureen E. Seeger is Executive Vice President and General Counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of the American Express Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both of those companies are clients of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board found that Mr. Fanandakis and Ms. Seeger are independent, after concluding that the Companys engagements with each of their employers or its subsidiaries are in the ordinary course of the Companys business on substantially the same terms as transactions with other clients of the Company for similar services, and neither Mr. Fanandakis nor Ms. Seeger has received any direct or indirect personal and pecuniary benefits from any of these client engagements or transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fees from such engagements amounted to less than the greater of $1.0 million or 2% of each such clients consolidated gross revenues for each year ended December 31, 2014, December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, during each of the years ended December 31, 2014, December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016, the Company has not made charitable contributions to any organization in which a director serves as an employee, officer, director or trustee, which in any single year exceeded the greater of $1.0 million or 2% of such organizations gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 1ELECT AS DIRECTORS THE EIGHT NOMINEES NAMED IN THE PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the eight incumbent directors nominated by the Board is standing for reelection at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee, if elected, will serve as a director for a term expiring at the next annual meeting of stockholders and until his or her successor is duly elected and qualifies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not know of any reason why any nominee would be unable to serve as a director, if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable to serve or for good cause will not serve, which is not anticipated, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may identify and recommend a candidate or candidates to the Board as a potential substitute nominee or nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If that happens, all valid proxies will be voted for the election of the substitute nominee or nominees designated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, the Board may determine to keep a vacancy open or reduce the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for a greater number of persons than the number of nominees named.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More detailed information about each of the eight nominees is provided in the section of this Proxy Statement titled Information about the Board of Directors and CommitteesInformation about the Nominees for Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Approval Required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee will be elected as a director if he or she receives the affirmative vote of a majority of the total votes cast FOR and WITHHELD with respect to his or her election as a director at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any abstentions or broker non-votes are not counted as votes cast either FOR or WITHHELD with respect to a directors election, and will have no effect on the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any incumbent director who does not receive the required vote will be subject to our mandatory resignation policy, which is described in the section of this Proxy Statement titled Corporate GovernanceOur Significant Corporate Governance Policies and Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Unanimously Recommends That You Vote FOR the Election of All Eight Nominees as Directors.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR ATTENDANCE AT MEETINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Board and Committee Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is expected to attend all meetings of the Board and each Committee of the Board on which he or she serves, unless excused for reasons of serious illness or extreme hardship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During each directors term of office during 2016, such director attended no less than 75% of the meetings held by the Board and each Committee on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Board and each Committee held the following number of meetings:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Audit Committee Compensation Committee Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee Total Meetings Held 9 6 7 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of presenting this information, each joint meeting of the Board and any Committee has been counted as a separate meeting of the Board and the applicable Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings that were adjourned one day and reconvened on another day have been counted as one meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance at Other Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent directors meet in closed (executive) sessions, without the presence of management, periodically throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board chairs the meetings of the independent directors, which coincide with regular meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our independent directors met in closed (executive) sessions four times without management, and each independent director attended more than 75% of such sessions held during his or her term.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee operate under written Committee Charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee Charters are reviewed annually, and more frequently as necessary, to address any new rules or best practices relating to the responsibilities of the applicable Committee, or changes to such rules and best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The applicable Committee approves its own Committee Charter amendment and submits it to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, which recommends action by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Committee Charter amendments are submitted to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the Charter of the Audit Committee, Charter of the Compensation Committee and Charter of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee are available on our website under AboutGovernance at http://www.fticonsulting.com/ about/governance, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name of Committee Website Link Audit Committee http://www.fticonsulting.com/~/media/Files/us-files/our-firm/guidelines/charter-of-the-audit-committee of-the-board-of-directors.pdf Compensation Committee http://www.fticonsulting.com/~/media/Files/us-files/our-firm/guidelines/charter-of-the-compensation- committee-of-the-board-of-directors.pdf Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee http://www.fticonsulting.com/~/media/Files/us-files/our-firm/guidelines/charter-of-the-nominating-and- corporate-governance-committee-of-the-board-of-directors.pdf
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all Audit Committee members are independent and otherwise qualify as Audit Committee members pursuant to applicable rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Audit Committee member is a member of more than three other audit committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all of the members of the Audit Committee qualify as audit committee financial experts within the meaning stipulated by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Functions of the Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: selects, oversees and retains our independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and discusses the scope of the annual audit and written communications by our independent registered public accounting firm to the Audit Committee and management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees our financial reporting activities, including the annual audit and the accounting standards and principles we follow;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves audit and non-audit services by our independent registered public accounting firm and applicable fees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and discusses our periodic reports filed with the SEC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and discusses our earnings press releases and communications with financial analysts and investors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees our internal audit activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees our disclosure controls and procedures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, internal control over financial reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees and monitors our Policy on Reporting Concerns and Non-Retaliation and related reports
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and discusses risk assessment and risk management policies and practices;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees the administration of the Code of Ethics and Business Conduct and other ethics policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews, discusses and approves insider and affiliated person transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administers the policy with respect to the hiring of former employees of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performs an annual self-evaluation of the Audit Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews its Committee Charter and recommends changes to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee for submission to the Board for approval; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prepares the audit committee report required to be included in the annual proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all Compensation Committee members are non-employee directors and qualify as independent directors under the Companys Categorical Standards of Director Independence and the NYSEs corporate governance rules, including the additional independence standards adopted by the NYSE on January 11, 2013 specific to compensation committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its determinations regarding the independence of each of the Compensation Committee members, the Board has considered all factors specifically relevant to determining whether a director has a relationship with the Company that would materially impair the directors ability to make independent judgments about executive officer compensation, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the source of such directors compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any consulting, advisory or other compensatory fees paid by the Company to the director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any other affiliations the director has with the Company and its affiliates, including engagements by clients that are companies or affiliates of companies for which members of the Compensation Committee serve as officers or directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the members of the Compensation Committee qualify as outside directors under Section 162(m) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (Code Section 162(m)) and non-employee directors under Rule 16b-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and Board solicit recommendations from our CEO and other officers regarding compensation matters, including the compensation of executive officers and key employees other than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They assist the Compensation Committee by providing information such as financial results, short-term and long-term business and financial plans, and strategic objectives, as well as their views on compensation programs and levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also recommend individual incentive pay opportunities, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) annual incentive pay (AIP) objective and operative performance measures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) AIP subjective individual performance goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) individual AIP award levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) long-term incentive pay (LTIP) performance measure(s); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) individual LTIP award levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also advises the Compensation Committee regarding the achievement of performance measures and goals, and payments under our incentive compensation plans and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO attended all Compensation Committee meetings held during 2016, other than meetings and executive sessions to which he was not invited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only members of the Compensation Committee vote on matters before that Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Advisors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its Committee Charter, the Compensation Committee is authorized to select, retain and direct the activities, and terminate the services, of compensation advisors, as well as approve fees and expenses of such advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged Frederick W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FWC) to advise the Compensation Committee on certain executive officer compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, during 2016, the Compensation Committee consulted Kirkland & Ellis LLP (K&E) and Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer US LLP (Freshfields) on certain legal aspects of executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Compensation Committee requested advice on a variety of issues, including short- and long-term executive incentive compensation programs and executive contract amendments, as well as our say-on-pay proposal and other compensation disclosures included in our proxy statement for our 2016 annual meeting of stockholders and this Proxy Statement for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither FWC nor the Company provided any services to the other during 2016, apart from the advisory services provided by FWC to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: K&E and Freshfields both provide services to the Company as outside corporate and employment counsel, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such capacities, they each advise the Company regarding executive officer and other compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company routinely is engaged by each of K&E and Freshfields to provide services to them or their clients in the ordinary course of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After consideration of the above factors, as well as information supplied by FWC, including its independence letter, the Compensation Committee concluded that FWC is independent and not subject to any conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the Companys relationships with each of K&E and Freshfields and their conflicts of interests policies and practices, the Compensation Committee concluded that K&E and Freshfields are not independent, but determined that they both offer unique, well-rounded perspectives on our executive officer compensation, and the matters on which they each advise the Compensation Committee do not constitute a conflict of interest, but are aligned with the interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee currently intends to continue to consult with FWC, K&E and Freshfields on executive officer compensation and other matters from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Functions of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves the compensation of our CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves the compensation of other executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administers our equity-based compensation plans and approves awards under such plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishes objective performance goals, individual award levels and operative and subjective performance measures, and oversees all aspects of executive officer incentive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves, or recommends that the Board approve, employment, consulting and other contracts, or arrangements with present and former executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the compensation disclosures in the annual proxy statement and Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC and discusses the disclosures with management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performs annual performance evaluations of our executive officers, in conjunction with the independent Chairman of the Board or other presiding director, as applicable, and Chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performs an annual self-evaluation of the Compensation Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews its Committee Charter and recommends changes to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee for submission to the Board for approval;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prepares the compensation committee report included in the annual proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: submits all equity-based compensation plans, executive officer compensation plans and material revisions to such plans to a vote of the Board, and to a vote of stockholders if stockholder approval is required;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensures that stockholders have the opportunity to vote on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an advisory (non-binding) resolution to approve the compensation of the Companys named executive officers in accordance with the frequency selected by stockholders and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the frequency of the stockholder advisory (non-binding) vote to approve the resolution approving the compensation of the named executive officers at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year ended December 31, 2016, no director who served as a member of the Compensation Committee has served as one of our officers or employees at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No executive officer serves as a member of the board or compensation committee of any other company that has an executive officer serving as a member of our Board or Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee consists of only non-employee directors, who qualify as independent directors under our Categorical Standards of Director Independence and the NYSE corporate governance rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Functions of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: identifies and qualifies the annual slate of directors for nomination by the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews non-employee director compensation and recommends changes to the Board for approval;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assesses the independence of directors for the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: identifies and qualifies the candidates for Chairman of the Board and for membership and chairmanship of the Committees for appointment by the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: identifies and qualifies candidates to fill vacancies occurring between annual meetings of stockholders for election by the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: monitors compliance with, and reviews proposed changes to, our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Committee Charters, and other policies and practices relating to corporate governance for submission to the Board for approval;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: monitors and reviews responses to stockholder communications with non-management directors together with th independent Chairman of the Board or presiding director, as applicable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees the process for director education;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees the process for Board and Committee annual self-evaluations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees the process for performance evaluations of our executive officers in conjunction with our independent Chairman of the Board or the presiding director, as applicable, and the Compensation Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: oversees the process relating to succession planning for our CEO and other executive officer positions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews directors and officers liability insurance terms and limits;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews its Committee Charter and recommends changes to the Board for approval; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performs an annual self-evaluation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION OF NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTORS AND POLICY ON NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTOR EQUITY OWNERSHIP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive annual retainer and equity compensation as described below pursuant to the FTI Consulting, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Director Compensation Plan, amended and restated effective as of January 1, 2016 (the Director Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse our non-employee directors for their out-of-pocket expenses incurred in the performance of their duties as our directors (including expenses related to spouses when spouses are invited to attend Board events).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay fees for attendance at Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table describes the components of non-employee director compensation for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Elements 2016 Director Compensation Values (1) (5) Alternative Forms of Payment Annual Retainer: (2) (5) (6) $50,000 Cash or Deferred Stock Units Annual Committee Chair Fees: (2) (5) $10,000Chair of Audit Committee $7,500Chair of Compensation Committee $5,000Chair of Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee Cash or Deferred Stock Units Additional Annual Non-Executive Chairman of the Board Fee: (2) (5) $200,000 Cash or Deferred Stock Units Annual Equity Award: (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) $250,000 Restricted Stock, Restricted Stock Units, Deferred Restricted Stock Units or Cash
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Following each annual meeting of stockholders, continuing non-employee directors receive payment of the annual retainer and annual equity award, and Chairman of the Board or Committee Chair fee, if applicable, as of the date of such annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A new non-employee director receives a prorated annual retainer and equity award upon first being appointed to the Board other than at an annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-employee director, who is appointed to a chairmanship other than following an annual meeting, receives a prorated non-executive Chairman of the Board or Committee Chair fee, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) U.S. non-employee directors are permitted to voluntarily defer annual retainer payments (including any annual fee to the non-executive Chairman of the Board or a Committee Chair) and/or annual equity compensation awards in the form of deferred stock units or deferred restricted stock units, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred stock units on account of deferred annual retainer and Chairman of the Board and/or Committee Chair fees are vested in full on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred restricted stock units granted on account of deferred annual equity compensation awards vest in full on the first anniversary of the grant date unless vesting is accelerated as described in footnote (4) below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each deferred stock unit and deferred restricted stock unit represents the right to receive one share of Common Stock upon the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a separation from service event and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) an elected payment date, in each case in accordance with Section 409A of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (Code Section 409A).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) The annual equity award, unless deferred, is in the form of shares of restricted stock, in the case of U.S. non-employee directors, and restricted stock units, in the case of non-U.S. non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each restricted stock unit represents the right to receive one share of Common Stock upon vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual equity awards are nontransferable and vest in full on the first anniversary of the grant date unless vesting is accelerated as described in footnote (4) below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) All unvested shares of restricted stock and restricted stock units will immediately vest in full upon a non-employee directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) death,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Disability,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) cessation of service within one year following a Change in Control, unless other
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accommodations are made with respect to such awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) cessation of service at the expiration of his or her term as a director due to the Companys failure to renominate such director for service on the Board (other than for Cause (as determined by the Board, in its good-faith discretion), due to the request of such director or as a result of a voluntary resignation)), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) cessation of service due to failure of the Companys stockholders to reelect such director for service on the Board (other than for cause (as determined by the Board, in its good-faith discretion)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) The number of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) deferred stock units awarded to a non-employee director as annual retainer compensation (including any annual fee to the non-executive Chairman of the Board or a Committee Chair) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) shares of restricted stock, restricted stock units and deferred restricted stock units awarded to a non-employee director as annual equity compensation, will be determined by dividing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the U.S. dollar value of such award by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the closing price per share of Common Stock reported on the NYSE for the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fractional restricted shares, restricted stock units, deferred stock units and deferred restricted share units are rounded down to the nearest whole share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) If we do not have sufficient shares of Common Stock authorized under our stockholder-approved equity compensation plans to fund annual retainer and equity awards in stock or stock-based equity awards, such awards will be funded in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout of such cash amounts will be subject to applicable deferred compensation payment, vesting and accelerated vesting conditions, subject to Code Section 409A, and such cash amounts generally will accrue interest at the rate of 6% per annum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
