sentences.text: Policy on Non-Employee Director Equity Ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Policy on Non-Employee Director Equity Ownership demonstrates our Boards continuing commitment to stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy sets each non-employee directors total investment level at five times (5x) the value of the annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-employee director will be required to meet the ownership level in effect when he or she first joins the Board within three years following receipt of his or her first director compensation payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors have three years to meet any increased ownership level during their tenure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under the policy, a non-employee director may not sell, transfer or dispose of shares of Common Stock if he or she does not attain or maintain the applicable equity ownership investment level at the initial ownership measurement date, or at June 30 of each year thereafter, except as necessary to pay or repay the cost of exercising a stock option or any tax obligations associated with the exercise of a stock option or vesting of stock-based awards, or as otherwise approved by the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of Common Stock that are, directly or indirectly,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) beneficially owned by such non-employee director or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) held in a trust over which such non-employee director has more than 50% of the beneficial interest and controls the management of the assets will count toward attaining and maintaining the applicable equity ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options, whether or not vested, will not count toward meeting the equity ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, restricted stock, restricted stock units, deferred stock units and deferred restricted stock units, whether or not vested, will count toward attaining and maintaining the non-employee directors applicable equity ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares of Common Stock counted toward attaining and maintaining the non-employee directors applicable ownership level will be valued at the average of the closing prices per share of Common Stock reported on the NYSE for each trading day in the 90-calendar-day period immediately preceding the applicable measurement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all of our non-employee directors were in compliance with our Policy on Non-Employee Director Equity Ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE PRINCIPLES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our governance policies, including Categorical Standards of Director Independence, Corporate Governance Guidelines, Code of Ethics and Business Conduct, Anti-Corruption Policy, Policy on Reporting Concerns and Non-Retaliation, Policy on Disclosure Controls and Policy on Inside Information and Insider Trading, as well as the Charters of the Committees, can be found on our website under AboutGovernance at http://www.fticonsulting.com/about/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those policies and other information on our website do not constitute a part of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paper copies of those documents may be obtained, without charge, upon request by contacting the Corporate Secretary, FTI Consulting, Inc., 2 Hamill Road, North Building, Baltimore, Maryland 21210.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee regularly reviews corporate governance developments and recommends modifications or new policies for adoption by the Board and the Committees, as appropriate, to enhance our corporate governance policies and practices, and to comply with the laws and rules of the SEC, the NYSE and other applicable governmental and regulatory authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR SIGNIFICANT CORPORATE GOVERNANCE POLICIES AND PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Listed below are our significant corporate governance policies and practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Director Elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders elect our directors annually to hold office to the next annual meeting of stockholders and until his or her successor is elected and qualifies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Independent Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gerard E. Holthaus is our non-executive independent Chairman o the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information about our Chairman of the Board may be found at Board Leadership Structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting in Uncontested Director Elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A nominee in an uncontested election shall be elected as a director only if such nominee receives the affirmative vote of a majority of the total votes cast FOR and WITHHELD as to such nominee at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any abstentions or broker non-votes are not counted as votes cast either FOR or WITHHELD with respect to a directors election, and will have no effect on the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that in an uncontested election, if an incumbent director fails to receive the required majority vote, he or she must offer to resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) consider such offer to resign,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) determine whether to accept such directors resignation, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) submit such recommendation for consideration by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director whose offer to resign is under consideration may not participate in any deliberation or vote of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee or Board regarding his or her offer of resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board may consider any factors they deem relevant in deciding whether to accept a directors offer to resign.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within 90 days after the date of certification of the election results, the Board will publicly disclose the Boards decision of whether or not to accept an offer of resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such incumbent directors offer to resign is not accepted by the Board, such director will continue to serve until his or her successor is elected and qualifies, or until his or her earlier death, resignation, retirement or removal (whichever occurs first).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a directors offer to resign is accepted by the Board, then the Board, in its sole discretion, may fill any resulting vacancy pursuant to the Companys Bylaws or reduce the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board meets regularly in executive session without the presence of management, including our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Rights Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a stockholder rights plan and are not currently considering adopting one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Power to Amend Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders, by the affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the shares of Common Stock, have the power to adopt, alter or repeal any Bylaw of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is free to choose its Chairman in any way that it deems best for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2013, the Board appointed Gerard E. Holthaus as its non-employee independent Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining who should hold that position, the Board considered Mr. Holthaus experience since 2006 as the Boards independent Presiding Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considered each directors individual experience and his or her experience serving as a director of other companies, particularly the experience of non-U.S. directors serving on the board of companies in locations where non-executive or independent chairmanships are common.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Holthaus continuing service as Chairman of the Board provides continuity in leadership and governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews its leadership structure and may make changes in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that separation of the CEO and Chairman of the Board positions balances the role of the Board to oversee the Companys business, on the one hand, and managements responsibilities to manage the Companys operations on a day-to-day basis, on the other hand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO is responsible for setting the strategic vision of the Company, leading the Companys day-to-day business, managing the executive officers and other key employees directed with implementing plans and carrying out operations, and reporting to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board structures the agendas for the Board meetings to ensure that topics deemed important by the independent directors are addressed, as well as to allow the Board to express its views on the Companys management, operations, material transactions, strategy and execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Chairman, Mr. Holthaus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) presides over meetings and executive sessions of the Board, and executive sessions of the independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) acts as a liaison between management and the independent directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) consults with our CEO,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) ensures that the Board and our CEO understand each others views on critical matters,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) monitors significant issues occurring between Board meetings and ensures Board involvement when appropriate,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) ensures the adequate and timely exchange of information and supporting data between the Companys management and the Board, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) receives stockholder communications addressed to the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERSIGHT OF RISK MANAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has delegated the critical responsibility for overall risk oversight to the Audit Committee, which reports to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management of the Company has primary responsibility for performing risk assessments, identifying and monitoring risks, establishing policies and processes, implementing and carrying out corporate responses, and reporting to the responsible Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews and discusses the enterprise risk management profile that management of the Company prepares and the policies and guidelines that management of the Company uses to manage risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee reviews and evaluates the performance and operations of our risk management function, which is managed by our Enterprise Risk Management Committee, consisting of members of management and employees with responsibilities for critical functions, such as accounting, information technology, internal audit, ethics, compliance and risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are exposed to a number of risks, including financial risks, operational risks, reputational risks, strategic risks, competitive risks, risks relating to operating in foreign countries, day-to-day management risks, information privacy and data and cyber security risks, general economic and business risks, and legal, regulatory and compliance risks, including risks associated with the Foreign Corrupt
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices Act (the FCPA) and foreign anti-bribery laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk and compliance officer manages our internal enterprise risk management function, working closely with members of our Enterprise Risk Management Committee and our executive management, business segments and corporate functions, to identify and assess risks and mitigate exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk and compliance officer regularly reports to and discusses with our executive management and Audit Committee our policies and procedures to identify and assess critical risk exposures, and the plans and actions that have been identified or taken by our internal audit, finance and management functions to correct, rehabilitate or mitigate risks facing the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are not members of the Audit Committee attend these meetings as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically requests additional reports on critical risk areas identified by management, such as the FCPA, the UK Anti-Bribery Act and cyber security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also reports to the Board on a regular basis to apprise them of the Companys risk profile and risk management, as well as discussions with our executive management, risk and compliance officer, and head of internal audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Audit Committee has primary responsibility for overseeing and monitoring enterprise risk management, each of the other two standing Committees of the Board also considers risks within its area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Compensation Committee reviews and discusses risks relating to the compensation policies and practices of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews legal and regulatory compliance risks as they relate to corporate governance, including the listing requirements of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These Committees also keep the Board apprised as to compensation- and governance-related risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION-RELATED RISKS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request and direction of the Compensation Committee and the Audit Committee, management conducted an assessment of risks associated with the Companys compensation policies and practices for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment included the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) review of programs, plans, policies and procedures relating to the components of executive officer and employee compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) review of incentive-based equity and cash compensation features,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) identification of compensation design features that could potentially encourage excessive or imprudent risk taking,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) identification of business risks that these features could potentially encourage,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) consideration of the presence or absence of controls, oversight or other factors that mitigate potential risks,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) assessment of potential risks, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) consideration of the potential for such risks to result in a material adverse effect on the Company and its subsidiaries taken as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the assessment and factors described above, the Company determined that the risks associated with its compensation policies and practices are not reasonably likely to result in a material adverse effect on the Company and its subsidiaries taken as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD AND COMMITTEE SELF-ASSESSMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, the Board and each Committee conducted its annual self-assessment to determine whether it is functioning effectively and to identify any areas for improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee acted as moderator and the results of the assessments were discussed by the Board and each applicable Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CODE OF CONDUCT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our written Code of Ethics and Business Conduct (Code of Ethics) and Anti-Corruption Policy (together with our Code of Ethics, our Code of Conduct) applies to financial professionals, including our Chief Financial Officer, corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer, and corporate Treasurer, as well as our CEO and all other officers, directors, employees and independent contractors of the Company and its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require all individuals subject to our Code of Conduct to avoid conflicts of interest, comply with applicable laws, including the FCPA, other anti-bribery laws and legal and regulatory requirements of the jurisdictions in which we have offices and conduct business, protect Company assets, conduct business in an honest and ethical manner, and otherwise act with integrity, in our best interests and in accordance with the Code of Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct prohibits insiders from knowingly taking advantage of corporate opportunities for personal benefit and taking unfair advantage of our business associates, competitors and employees through manipulation, concealment, abuse of privileged information, misrepresentation of material facts or any other practice of unfair dealing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Ethics and Anti-Corruption Policy are publicly available and can be found on our website under AboutGovernance at http://www.fticonsulting.com/~/media/Files/ us-files/our-firm/guidelines/fti-code-of-conduct.pdf and http://www.fticonsulting.com/~/media/Files/us-files/our-firm/guidelines/ anti-corruption-policy.pdf, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we make substantive amendments to the Code of Ethics or grant any waiver, including any implicit waiver, from a provision of such policy to any officer, financial professional or person performing similar functions, we will disclose the nature of such amendment or waiver on our website or in a Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Ethics was last updated in any material respect in September 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not receive any notices of stockholder nominees for director prior to the deadline for 2017 nominations described in our proxy statement for the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our current Bylaws, nominations for director at an annual meeting of stockholders may be made by a stockholder who is a stockholder of record both at the time of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the giving of the notice by the stockholder and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the record date for the determination of stockholders entitled to vote at such meeting; provided such stockholder delivers notice along with the additional information and materials required by our Bylaws, including, as to each person whom the stockholder proposes to nominate for election as a director, all information relating to such person that is required by the SECs proxy rules to be disclosed in connection with solicitations of proxies for the election of directors, to the Corporate Secretary at our principal executive office of the Company, which at that time will be located at 555 12th Street NW, Washington, DC 20004, not earlier than the 150th day nor later than 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time, on the 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the date of the proxy statement for the preceding years annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the annual meeting of stockholders in 2018, you must deliver this notice no earlier than November 26, 2017 and no later than December 26, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that the date of the annual meeting is advanced or delayed by more than 30 days from the first anniversary of the date of the preceding years annual meeting of stockholders, notice by the stockholder to be timely must be so delivered not earlier than the 150th day prior to the date of such annual meeting and not later than 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time, on the later of the 120th day prior to the date of such annual meeting, as originally convened, or the tenth day following the day on which public announcement of the date of such meeting is first made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that the number of directors to be elected to the Board is increased and there is no public announcement of such action at least 130 days prior to the first anniversary of the date of the proxy statement for the preceding years annual meeting, a stockholders notice will also be considered timely, but only with respect to nominees for any new positions created by such increase, if it is delivered to the Corporate Secretary at our principal executive office of the Company, which at that time will be located at 555 12th Street NW, Washington, DC 20004, not later than 5:00 p.m., Eastern Time, on the tenth day following the day on which we first make such public announcement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The public announcement of a postponement or adjournment of an annual meeting shall not commence a new time period for the giving of a stockholders notice as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may obtain a copy of our Bylaws, without charge, by writing to our Corporate Secretary at FTI Consulting, Inc., 2 Hamill Road, North Building, Baltimore, Maryland 21210, telephone no.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We filed a copy of our Bylaws, as amended and restated through June 1, 2011, with the SEC on June 2, 2011 as an exhibit to our Current Report on Form 8-K dated June 1, 2011, and we filed copies of Amendments No. 1 and No. 2 to our Bylaws through December 13, 2013 and September 17, 2014, respectively, as exhibits to our Current Reports on Form 8-K filed with the SEC on December 16, 2013 and September 22, 2014, respectively.

sentences.text: COMMUNICATIONS WITH DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders, employees and other interested persons may communicate with our Board or any individual director using the FTI Consulting Integrity Hotline, which allows interested persons to place confidential reports by either telephone or the Internet, without divulging their name or other personal information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reporting website may be accessed from any Internet-enabled computer at www.fticonsulting.ethicspoint.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone reports may be placed through the FTI Consulting Integrity Hotline by calling +1.866.294.3576 (toll free) in the U.S. Reports submitted through the FTI Consulting Integrity Hotline will be sent to designated recipients within the Company, which includes our Vice PresidentChief Risk and Compliance Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If interested persons do not feel comfortable using the FTI Consulting Integrity Hotline, they may communicate with our Board or an individual director by contacting our Vice PresidentChief Risk and Compliance Officer, by telephone to Matthew Pachman, at +1.202.312.9100, by mail to his attention at FTI Consulting, Inc., 1101 K Street NW, Washington, DC 20005, prior to June 5, 2017, and 555 12th Street NW, Washington, DC 20004, after June 5, 2017, or by email to matthew.pachman@fticonsulting.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications directed to the Board or independent directors, depending upon the subject matter, will be directed to the Chairman of the Board, Chair of the Audit Committee or Chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee or other appropriate person who is responsible for ensuring that the concerns expressed are investigated and appropriately addressed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will not filter any such communications.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2VOTE ON THE APPROVAL OF THE FTI CONSULTING, INC. 2017 OMNIBUS INCENTIVE COMPENSATION PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to approve the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2017 Omnibus Incentive Compensation Plan effective as of June 7, 2017 (the 2017 Plan), which, among things, authorizes shares of our Common Stock for equity grants to our officers, employees, individual service providers and non-employee directors of the Company and its subsidiaries, consisting of the sum of the following, subject to adjustment as provided in the 2017 Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number of shares of our Common Stock remaining available for issuance and not subject to outstanding awards under the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2009 Omnibus Incentive Compensation Plan, as amended and restated effective as of June 3, 2015 (the 2009 Plan), as of the date of the Annual Meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any additional shares of our Common Stock subject to outstanding awards under the 2009 Plan, the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2006 Global Long-Term Incentive Plan, as amended and restated effective May 14, 2008, as amended from time to time (the 2006 Plan), and the FTI Consulting, Inc. 2004 Long-Term Incentive Plan, as amended from time to time (the 2004 Plan), as of the date of the Annual Meeting that may be forfeited, canceled, surrendered, cash-settled, tendered or withheld, from time to time, and returned to the Company; plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 850,000 additional new shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors approved the 2017 Plan on March 28, 2017, authorizing a maximum new share limit of up to 1,000,000 additional shares of our Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On April 15, 2017, the Compensation Committee approved, subject to such maximum new share limit set by the Board, the number of additional new shares of Common Stock under the 2017 Plan, subject to the approval of our stockholders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan shall be administered by a committee appointed by the Board that shall consist solely of independent directors, which shall be the Compensation Committee (the Administrator) as of the date of approval by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon approval of the 2017 Plan at the Annual Meeting, no further awards will be granted under the 2009 Plan, but outstanding awards under the 2009 Plan, 2006 Plan and 2004 Plan as of the Annual Meeting will continue to remain outstanding in accordance with their applicable terms and the terms of the applicable plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, if the 2017 Plan is not approved by stockholders at the Annual Meeting, the 2009 Plan will continue to remain in full force and effect and the Company will continue to have the right to make grants under the 2009 Plan, subject to the existing share reserve under the 2009 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion of the 2017 Plan is qualified in its entirety by the complete text of the 2017 Plan attached to this Proxy Statement as Appendix A. You may request a copy of the 2017 Plan, free of charge, from the Corporate Secretary, FTI Consulting, Inc., 2 Hamill Road, North Building, Baltimore, Maryland 21210, telephone no.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Burn Rate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the course of its history, the Company has made significant equity grants to align the interests of its leaders and senior professionals with those of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since our leadership succession in 2014, the Compensation Committee and our management team have sought to reduce our average share usage rate (sometimes referred to as burn rate) while still seeking to maximize the benefits of equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys unadjusted burn rate for the three-year period ended December 31, 2016 was 2.01%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unadjusted burn rate has been calculated based on our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) non-weighted total number of shares of our Common Stock issuable upon the grant or exercise, as the case may be, of the equity-based awards granted for the applicable fiscal year, divided by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) weighted average total number of shares of Common Stock issued and outstanding during the applicable fiscal year, in each case excluding performance-based equity awards that have not been earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The burn rate is unadjusted because it is determined before giving effect to the 2.5:1 premium share counting rule, discussed below, for certain equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our adjusted burn rate for the three-year period ended December 31, 2016 was 3.89%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted burn rate has been calculated (based on our understanding of the methodology utilized by Institutional Shareholder Services, Inc. (ISS)) by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) applying a 2.5:1 premium factor to the number of full-value awards (stock-based awards) granted each year and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) excluding performance-based equity awards that have not been earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our adjusted burn rate of 3.89% is lower than ISS adjusted burn rate of 4.14% of our industry classification group for the same period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This compares with our adjusted burn rate for the three-year period ended December 31, 2013 of 5.82% (recalculated on the basis described above), demonstrating our successful management of equity usage over the relevant periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company repurchased zero, 765,000 and 537,000 shares of Common Stock during the years ended December 31, 2014, December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The share repurchases partially offset dilution from equity grants in the relevant years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, such share repurchases also had the effect of reducing the denominator used to calculate our burn rate, which consequently inflated our reported burn rate for the years ended December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016, and the three- year period ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our three-year average share usage rate, we expect that the shares available under the 2017 Plan will enable the Company to continue to grant equity as a portion of compensation for approximately three years (including 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unadjusted Burn Rate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The below table sets forth the unadjusted burn rate calculations for the three-year period ended December 31, 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options Granted Full Value Shares (1) Total Weighted Average Number of Common Shares Outstanding Burn Rate (in thousands, except for percentages) Years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Excludes performance-based restricted stock unit awards for approximately 84,000 and 81,000 shares at maximum, granted in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no stock-based performance awards granted in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No performance-based equity awards were earned in each of 2016, 2015 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) 2014 includes the employment inducement awards that were granted to David M. Johnson, our former Chief Financial Officer (Former CFO), and Paul Linton, our Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer (CSTO), on August 25, 2014, outside of our equity plans pursuant to Rule 303A.08 of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted Burn Rate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The below table sets forth the adjusted burn rate calculations for the three-year period ended December 31, 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options Granted Full Value Shares (1) Total Granted Total Weighted Average Number of Common Shares Outstanding Burn Rate (in thousands, except for percentages) Years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Excludes performance-based restricted stock unit awards for approximately 84,000 and 81,000 shares at maximum, granted in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no stock-based performance awards granted in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No performance-based equity awards were earned in each of 2016, 2015 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The Adjusted burn rate has been calculated by applying a 2.5:1 premium factor to share-based awards to calculate the total full value shares granted for each of 2016, 2015 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if 100 shares are issued with respect to a restricted stock award, 250 shares will be counted to determine adjusted burn rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) 2014 includes the employment inducement awards that were granted to our Former CFO and our CSTO on August 25, 2014, outside of our equity plans pursuant to Rule 303A.08 of the NYSE,.

sentences.text: Key Plan Provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan includes key provisions designed to protect stockholder interests and promote effective corporate governance, including, but not limited to, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No discounted stock options and stock appreciation rights (SARs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options and SARs may not be granted with an exercise price lower than the closing price per share of Common Stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No repricing of stock options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator may not reprice stock options or SARs, including through the cancellation or replacement of such stock options or SARs, without stockholder approval, or permit the cash buyout of underwater stock options or SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No automatic reloads of stock options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan does not provide for the automatic reload of stock options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No evergreen provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no evergreen or automatic replenishment provision pursuant to which the shares authorized for issuance under the 2017 Plan are automatically replenished.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No automatic grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan does not provide for automatic grants to any eligible participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual limit on non-employee director awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate fair value (computed as of the applicable grant date) of total compensation (consisting of cash retainers and other cash compensation, as well as equity awards granted under the 2017 Plan) to any non-employee director in any calendar year shall not exceed $750,000, subject to Board discretion to make exceptions to the limit for a non-executive Chairman of the Board or, in extraordinary circumstances, for an individual non-employee director; provided, that the non-employee director receiving such additional compensation may not participate in the decision to award such compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual limit on performance-based executive officer awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of awards intended to be performance-based compensation for purposes of Code Section 162(m), the maximum number of shares of our Common Stock granted during any calendar year to any one individual will be limited to 350,000 shares of our Common Stock per type of award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such per-individual limit will not be adjusted for any award (and related shares of Common Stock) that has been terminated, surrendered or canceled during the applicable year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividends or dividend equivalents on unearned awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash, stock and any other property declared as a dividend or dividend equivalent with respect to any equity award shall not be distributed, paid or credited, but may be accumulated and distributed, paid or credited at the time that any applicable restrictions or risks of forfeiture with respect to such award shall lapse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No automatic acceleration on a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan does not provide for automatic single trigger equity acceleration or severance benefits on a Change in Control (as defined in the 2017 Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
